text: the latest traffic updates for the northern distributor road ( ndr ) :

documents.title: ex-staff member stole nearly £ 153,000 from hospital endowment account
text: a staff member sacked by the norfolk and norwich university hospital over anomalies to a bank account has admitted stealing £ 152,697 .
thefts were made between january 2011 and november 2016 by steven hart , 41 , of arlington close , attleborough , norwich magistrates ' court was told .
hart pleaded guilty to theft today and will be sentenced at norwich crown court at a date to be fixed .
he was released on unconditional bail .

a spokesman for the hospital said : `` the trust 's finance department discovered apparent anomalies in one of our bank accounts in january 2017 and , following investigation , a junior member of staff was suspended and subsequently dismissed and the matter referred to the police .
`` given the ongoing legal proceedings it would not be appropriate to comment any further . ''
author: Patrick Byrne
BBC News

documents.title: child sex offender 's jail time doubled
text: child sex offender 's jail time doubled

documents.title: sundown festival : 'a massive revamp '
text: as we 've been mentioning the past couple of days , thousands of music fans are heading to the norfolk showground for this year 's sundown festival .
it gets under way tonight , with artists such as artful dodger and jess bays , and continues over the weekend .
the event is in its fifth year and promoter roy trickett says festival-goers will see some big changes .
`` the whole site has had a massive revamp the whole vibe , the layout , it 's just a complete revamp we 've moved the campsite , we 've got six stages now and tonight 's opening party is huge . ''
roy explains why the festival has proved so popular
it 's the end of the run the v 's have gone , leeds and reading , latitude this is the last one before the kids go back to colleges , unis and school , so it 's a great way to end the summer . ''

documents.title: villagers help bring new life back into church
text: a community in west norfolk has been raising money to bring new life into their parish church .
st andrew 's , in walpole st andrew , was made redundant in 1986 .
since then it 's fallen into disrepair and been targeted by lead thieves .
pete ayres , of the churches conservation trust , praised the local community for their help in bringing new life back into the building .
`` we have raised a significant amount of money we 're just about to start repairing the roof - it means we can keep the building going and it 's so important that we do , '' said mr ayres .
elaine broden , who lives in the village , says they still have some fundraising to do , but they know the church will never be a working church again .
it would be really lovely just to use the space so that people can come together , younger and older , even once a month . ''

documents.title: the latest weather forecast : sunshine and showers
text: it 's due to remain warm , with temperatures expected to reach 20c ( 68f ) .
there 'll be some heavy showers , mostly near the coast , with sunny spells in the west of the county .
weather has more details for you .
we hope you enjoy this latest selection of photos from our bbc weather watchers :

documents.title: roundabout upgrade to get under way
text: work to widen a busy roundabout in norwich is set to begin on monday .
norfolk county council and norwich city council are improving the junction where dereham road , sweet briar road and guardian road meet .
the project is designed to make the junction work more efficiently and improve bus journey times .
there will also be new crossings and widened footways for pedestrians and cyclists .
the work , which is part of the transport for norwich project , is set to continue until april 2018 .

documents.title: teen assault victim suffers bleed on the brain
text: a 16-year-old boy suffered a bleed on the brain following an attack in gorleston last week .
the assault was carried out by one person at about 17:00 on friday , 27 august .
the boy needed hospital treatment , but is now at home recovering .
anyone who may have witnessed the assault , or who has information , has been asked to contact norfolk police or crimestoppers anonymously .

documents.title: 'keep safe ' at sundown festival
text: with headline acts like craig david , rag'n'bone man , pendulum and artful dodger , thousands of people will descend on the norfolk showground for the sundown festival .
police are asking festival-goers to keep their personal belongings safe , and also to behave responsibly .
their advice to those who will be camping at the event is to bring only those items that are essential and to think about the security of valuable items .
they also urge those attending the festival to adhere to any security advice given by the event organisers and to allow extra time for any checks that will take place .
motorists are warned to expect heavy traffic on the a47 and a1074 dereham road .
if you 're camping this weekend @ twitterid avoid naked flames near your tent >

text: today marks the start of meteorological autumn and this was reflected in the overnight temperatures .
santon donwham , on the norfolk-suffolk border , had the coldest night since 15 may , as this tweet from weatherquest 's dan holley shows .
how cold was it where you live ?
e anglia : a chilly start to meteorological autumn santon downham dipped down to 3.2c , while 40 miles away cromer fell no lower than 11.4c

text: firefighters dealt with a major car fire yesterday afternoon in hellesdon , near norwich .
fire crews were called to the vehicle parked in front of a bungalow on reepham road at about 16:30 .
a fire engine from reepham attended and the fire was extinguished .
author: Nic Rigby

it will be chilly tonight , with lows of 7c ( 45f ) .

documents.title: police operation to tackle online child sexual abuse helps dozens of youngsters
text: a police investigation to combat online child exploitation in norfolk and suffolk has safeguarded more than 60 children since it was launched in 2014 .
operation bane has seen the team work closely with the national crime agency and use specialist techniques to detect , identify and risk-assess offenders .
more than 200 arrests have been made locally since its launch , leading to a number of convictions .
these include a man is his 30s , who was jailed in july 2015 for the rape of a girl .
he was arrested following information that indecent images of children were being downloaded at his suffolk address .
a man in his 40s , from norfolk , was also jailed for 18 years in september 2016 after being found guilty of raping , sexually assaulting and taking indecent images of a young girl .
the operation is being conducted in partnership with child protection charity the lucy faithfull foundation .

documents.title: missing mother and children found
text: a woman and her three children who 'd been reported missing have all be found .
mary sagyarani nareshkumar , 27 , had last been seen heading towards the riverside retail park in norwich yesterday afternoon .
norfolk police say the mother and children were found `` safe and well '' this afternoon .

documents.title: time heals as jason donovan re-schedules tour dates
text: problems with his speaking voice has led to jason donovan postponing his midlife crisis tour until next year .
the neighbours-turned-pop legend says it 's not a decision he 's taken lightly , adding that he 's only cancelled a handful of dates out of hundreds of shows .
posting on twitter , he explains that it 's difficult to embark on a 35-date tour when his speaking voice is strained .
`` i want to be on top form so that you as an audience can share these memories without a sense i 'm compromising my performance , therefore my personality '' .
but before there are too many broken hearts , your tickets will be valid for the revised dates :

documents.title: feed the bins not the birds
text: a council is asking the public to feed the bins , not the birds , as part of a campaign to reduce the number of gulls in great yarmouth .
great yarmouth borough council says the increase in the number and distribution of the gulls in recent years is a direct result of people disposing of waste irresponsibly , or feeding the birds .
it 's now launched a series of stickers for litter bins and businesses in key locations in the town , including the market place .

councillor carl smith , chairman of the environment committee , said the growth of their population was `` not natural '' , and its spread into more suburban areas is due to people not disposing of their waste responsibly .

`` while some want a mass cull , this would be highly illegal and studies have found that this would not be an effective solution as the gull population rises or falls to meet the amount of food available , '' he said .
environmental health officer jason williams says the birds are intelligent , social and nest together with close access to food and litter .
with less food about , they 'll lay fewer eggs or go elsewhere for richer

documents.title: norwich city left-back in deadline day move
text: norwich city left-back harry toffolo has joined league one doncaster rovers on loan until the end of the year .
toffolo was part of city 's fa youth cup winning side in 2013 .
he was on loan at scunthorpe united last season and played 21 games .

documents.title: concern for welfare of missing mum and children
text: police are appealing for help in tracing a norwich woman who 's missing with her three children .
mary sagyarani nareshkumar , 27 , was last seen heading towards the riverside retail park in norwich at 16:00 yesterday .
mary is about 5ft 2in ( 1.6m ) tall and of slim build .
she was last seen wearing a blue jacket with blue trousers .
officers are concerned for her welfare and anyone with information has been asked to contact norfolk police .

documents.title: latest weather forecast : sunshine and showers
text: what better way of spending the last days of the summer than heading to the beach for a paddle ?
i 'm afraid it 's not due to last .
this afternoon will turn cloudy , with showers which could be heavy at times with the risk of thunder .
temperatures will peak at 19c ( 66f ) .
weather has more .

documents.title: ukip leadership contenders pitch to norfolk supporters
text: more than 100 members of the uk independence party gathered in norwich last night to hear from the candidates who want to become ukip 's next leader .
a total of 10 candidates are standing in the election to choose the party 's fifth leader in a year .
seven were there last night - david coburn , jane collins , david kurten , marion mason , aidan powlesland , ann marie waters and peter whittle .
two of the other candidates - henry bolton and john rees-evans - could n't make it but sent representatives .
ben walker is also standing .
hustings are currently taking place around the country , but the norfolk one was seen as one of the most important given the party 's previous strength in the county .
ukip was a major force on the county council until it lost all its seats in may , but the party still has a significant presence on great yarmouth borough council .
last night 's meeting was closed to the press , but i understand that all the candidates talked about the need for ukip to become a party which focuses on issues other than europe .
many felt the nhs should now be the party 's main concern .
party members told me they were looking for a leader who could unite the party , but also have the personality to get ukip noticed .
ballot papers go out tomorrow and the result will be announced at the end of september .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: sundown festival : 'make personal safety number one ' , say police
text: with 40,000 people expected at the sundown festival in norwich this weekend , police are reminding people to make their own personal safety a priority .
ch insp nathan clark says festival-goers are urged to keep their personal belongings safe and to behave responsibly .
officers will also be monitoring alcohol sales to ensure there 's no underage drinking .
he has this warning for those found with psychoactive substances , which have been banned by the organisers of sundown .

it is an offence to supply them or to have them in your possession with the intent to supply people will be searched on entry to the site anyone found in possession of illegal drugs or psychoactive substances will be ejected from the festival and may face police action . ''

documents.title: cromer disturbances : your chance to question police
text: a public meeting is to be held in cromer next week giving people the chance to question the police about their response to recent disorder in the town .
norfolk 's police and crime commissioner , lorne green , has set up a police accountability forum to examine the handling of disturbances in the area on the week of 18 august .
more than 35 crimes were recorded in the town over three days , including a rape at a bus stop on cadogan road .
two men arrested in connection with the attack have been released on bail .
people will be able to put questions to both the commissioner and the chief constable , simon bailey , at cromer parish hall on 6 september , starting at 17:30 .

text: early morning mist patches will quickly clear , leaving a bright morning .
it 'll turn cloudy later , with showers developing and these could be heavy at times .
feeling warmer than yesterday , with temperatures reaching 19c ( 66f ) .
there 's a more detailed forecast for where you are on bbc weather .

BBC Look East weather

text: welcome back to norfolk live - throughout the day we 'll be here with the latest news updates from around the county .
today marks the 20th anniversary of the death of diana , princess of wales in a car crash in paris .
she was born at park house , sandringham in july 1961 .
if you have any memories of the princess that you 'd like to share with us , click on the `` get involved '' button at the top of the page to get in touch .

scroll down to bring yourself up-to-date on what 's been happening across the county during the day and remember you can send us your thoughts via the `` get involved '' link at the top of this page .
have a good evening , and thanks for your company .

documents.title: weather : rain becoming patchy later
text: there 's not much change this evening as it 'll be staying cloudy and cold with further outbreaks of rain , though this will gradually ease to become lighter and more patchy later .
mist and fog patches are possible during the night .
it 'll also feel chilly as temperatures dip to between 5-10c ( 41-50f ) .
thursday will see a fresh start to the day with some good spells of sunshine , but scattered showers are expected during the afternoon , some heavy and thundery .
feeling warmer than today with highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: missing wreck diver named
text: a scuba diver missing off the norfolk coast has been named as brighton man terry tonkin .
the 67-year-old had been diving on a wreck when on monday the coastguard was called after he failed to return to a dive vessel which had departed from the port of lowestoft .
the group had been in the water 15 miles ( 24.1km ) offshore from great yarmouth when the alarm was raised .
after 14 hours , the search by the coastguard was suspended pending further information .

documents.title: travel : major traffic delays in norwich city centre
text: we mentioned earlier that a burst water main had closed a road in norwich city centre .
exchange street was shut following the burst yesterday afternoon , anglian water repaired the leak overnight , but the road had been damaged from the water
for this reason , the road remains closed and traffic is moving at a crawl around the city - particularly in the area by the grapes hill roundabout , theatre street and bethel street .
the traffic is so heavy it is also causing problems for the emergency services - this ambulance was halted by the congestion at the top of rampant horse street .

documents.title: travel : trains back on track after break down
text: train services between norwich and london are beginning to get back to normal this afternoon .
all lines were closed earlier today after a train broke down at ingatestone , blocking the tracks .
hundreds of passengers were delayed as trains were held at stations until the broken down carriages could be moved .
all lines have now re opened .
a greater anglia spokesperson said : `` several services were delayed or cancelled this morning due to a broken down train at ingatestone .
`` engineers were unable to fix the fault and the train terminated at chelmsford .
`` we apologise for the disruption .
anyone affected may be entitled to claim delay repay compensation . ''

documents.title: two men bailed over bus stop rape
text: two men bailed over bus stop rape

documents.title: energy minister promises 'full support ' to maximise north sea
text: the new energy minister richard harrington has told oil and gas leaders they have the `` full support '' of the uk government in maximising the economic potential of the north sea .
`` these are challenging but exciting times with new opportunities in north sea oil and gas , '' he said .

`` i want to make it clear that the industry has full support of the uk government , and that we are continuing to create the right environment though a stable and supportive package to allow business , enterprise and jobs to flourish . ''

the government has committed more than £ 2bn to encourage oil and gas companies to drill deeper in the north sea and extract oil and gas which has previously been considered too uneconomical to mine .
over the past 50 years the oil and gas industry has extracted more than 43 billion barrels from the north sea .
current production accounts for more than 50 % of uk gas demand and about 65 % of uk oil demand .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: ukip leadership candidates to make their case in norwich
text: those who want to be the next leader of the uk independence party will be making their case to party members in norwich tonight .
it will be the party 's fifth leader in a year .
norfolk has been seen as a ukip stronghold , but support has been falling following the referendum .
tonight 's meeting has been organised by former county councillor michael baker .
he says ukip need a leader who can turn around the party 's fortunes .
`` i think we 're looking for someone who can come up with a policy and manifesto which will appeal to a wide range of people , '' he said .

documents.title: afternoon weather : breezy with rain
text: it 's a good day to show off your umbrella - as it 'll be a rather wet afternoon with persistent rain , feeling significantly cooler than of late and quite breezy at times .
towards the end of the afternoon it will begin to turn drier .
maximum temperature : 17c ( 63f ) .
for the full forecast where you are , visit bbc weather .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: hospital to increase mental health staff
text: extra mental health staff are being taken on to look after patients at the norfolk and norwich hospital .
the norfolk and suffolk nhs trust has a grant from the government to take on 21 extra staff by april next year .
this will add to the current team of 13 .
the trust says they ca n't ignore the rising numbers needing help at hospital .
the team will aim to assess mentally ill patients at a & e within an hour .
micki munro , from the mental health trust , said it does n't mean people should go to a & e as a first port of call .
`` a & e is n't the best place for a mental health assessment to take place , the environment is very busy .
`` the reason why the investment is there is to try and get these people seen quickly in a & e , so it does n't exasperate the problem , '' she said .

documents.title: city road closure after burst water main
text: a burst water main has closed one of the main roads in the centre of norwich .
exchange street was shut following the burst yesterday afternoon , forcing traffic to back up around the one-way system .
we have asked anglian water how long it will take to fix the leak - but are yet to hear back from them .
author: Paul Moseley
BBC Radio Norfolk

documents.title: 'missing fisherman ' search called off
text: 'missing fisherman ' search called off

documents.title: hopes fade for missing diver as search called off
text: hopes are fading for the family of a diver who went missing off the great yarmouth coast on monday night .
the search for the 68-year-old from brighton was called off yesterday afternoon after 14 hours of air and sea searches .
the man failed to surface after diving a wreck from the raider v .
his family say they do not want him to be named yet , but have told the bbc of their shock .
the missing diver 's niece says the family still have hope he 'll be found alive but if he is n't , they will take comfort in the fact he was doing something he loved .
tommy williams , from caister lifeboat , says the search teams did their best to find him .
`` we do it for the families .
if it was my relative out there i would want all the accessible crews , life boats and helicopters out there looking for them .
`` we have done our job and i 'm pretty happy with what we have done . ''

the 06:00 service from norwich to london liverpool street has broken down due to an `` unknown brake fault '' .
services running through chelmsford may be cancelled or delayed by up to 40 minutes .
disruption is expected until 10:00 .

documents.title: welcome back
text: good morning and welcome back to local live across norfolk .
we 'll be here until 18:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for your local area .
the full weather forecast will be with you shortly , but it 's a rather grey start to the day .
as always , if you want to get in touch you can by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: daisy defies doctors with triathlon
text: daisy defies doctors with triathlon

documents.title: overnight weather : cloud increasing bringing outbreaks of rain by morning
text: after the warmest late august bank holiday monday in the bbc east region since 1984 , changes are on the way .
this evening will be mainly dry , but some heavy showers will develop across eastern parts of essex and suffolk , gradually clearing later .
cloud increasing from the west during the evening and overnight , with outbreaks of rain by the early hours of wednesday morning .
lows of 14c ( 54f ) .
wednesday will be a much cooler day , with cloud and outbreaks of rain .
feeling chilly in a top temperature of 17c ( 63f ) .
get the full forecast where you are , from bbc weather .
author: Alex Dolan
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: district authority says harleston car parks are not for sale
text: south norfolk council says the car parks in harleston are not for sale as residents prepare to have their say on their future .
author: Diss Express

documents.title: victim of a47 crash named
text: a motorcycle rider who died following a two-vehicle collision on the a47 at blundeston yesterday morning has been named as nigel last , 37 , of aldeby near beccles .

police were called by the ambulance service at about 11:35 to reports a motorbike had been in collision with a vauxhall corsa on the yarmouth road , near the market lane junction between gorleston and lowestoft
mr last died at the scene .

documents.title: man arrested after car crashes into two houses in great yarmouth
text: a man has been arrested on sus of drink-driving , after a car crashed into two houses in great yarmouth on sunday night .
it happened on northgate street and the driver , 20 , has been released under investigation .

graham capps , whose son dale owns one of the houses that was hit , says it 's the second time it 's happened this year : `` this time there 's a bit of devastation , it 's took the porch and everything out .
`` the building next door , it 's cracked the wall - it 's a major job this time . ''

text: search under way for 'missing fisherman '

documents.title: bank holiday sees slight increase in calls to ambulance service
text: some 7,976 calls were made to the east of england ambulance service ( eeas ) over the three-day bank holiday weekend .
it 's a 2 % increase compared to last year 's bank holiday weekend .
the figures for each county for this year compared to last ( in brackets ) are as follows : -
the total for the bank holiday weekend in 2016 was 7,823 .

the bank holiday weekend is reported as being one of the hottest on record for decades and usually we would see a marked increase to match i would like to thank the public for choosing wisely over the weekend . ''

documents.title: tornado makes second trip to east anglia this time without delays
text: two weeks ago , the tornado steam engine visited essex and its journeys were regularly disrupted by people trespassing on the line to take photos .
after warnings issued by british transport police , its latest visit , from london to great yarmouth , passed without similar problems through hertfordshire , cambridgeshire , suffolk and norfolk .
it case you missed it , here 's footage from saturday , 12 august , of the recreated engine 's visit to celebrate the 150th anniversary of the arrival of the railway in walton-on-the-naze :

documents.title: witness appeal following serious colision
text: a man remains in hospital with serious injuries , after his car hit a tree on the a140 at aylsham on sunday night .
emergency services attended the scene of the crash , involving a green mg zs , which happened at about 23:00 .
the road was closed until 06:00 on monday morning .

documents.title: man arrested following stabbing in norwich
text: a man in his 30s was found with knife wounds to his neck and hands in riverside road in norwich last night .
he was taken to the norfolk & norwich hospital for treatment .
a man in his 20s has since been arrested and taken to the wymondham police investigation centre for questioning .
a seal around the area remains in place while investigations continue .

documents.title: motorcyclist killed in a47 crash
text: a motorcyclist was killed in a two-vehicle crash on the a47 between lowestoft and great yarmouth yesterday morning .
police say they were called to the scene , on the yarmouth road at the junction with market lane in blundeston shortly after 11:30 .
the motorcyclist , a man in his 30s , died at the scene .
the driver of the car , a vauxhall corsa , suffered minor injuries and was taken to hospital for treatment .
police are appealing for witnesses , especially those with dash-cam footage .

BBC Look East

documents.title: swardeston win cricket 's carter cup
text: swardeston took the honours in norfolk 's showpiece cricket final , the carter cup .
they beat norwich by 10 wickets after bowling them out for just 112 at manor park .
openers jordy taylor and jason reynolds needed less than 18 overs to take swardeston to their victory target .
the start of the match was delayed because of concerns about the pitch .
umpire brett gates took it upon himself to cut some the grass on the playing surface .
congratulations to @ twitterid on winning the carter cup .
opener jordy taylor named man of the match as they beat norwich by 10 wickets .
here 's the cup being presented to @ twitterid skipper joe gatting .
and the champagne moment .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: linnets and magpies continue promising starts to season
text: king 's lynn town remain unbeaten this season after coming from behind to win 3-1 at st ives on bank holiday monday .
tom siddons scored twice and substitute harry whayman was also on target as the linnets won despite being a goal down with just 13 minutes remaining .
they are third in the southern premier .
dereham town made it four wins out of four in bostick north .
ashley jarvis scored a hat-trick in their 3-1 win at norwich united .
the planters are bottom of the table having lost all four of their matches so far .
ft : st ives 1-3 lynn .
linnets come from behind to rightfully win this bank holiday fixture @ twitterid a brace and @ twitterid the scorers
great to see harry ! !
well done kings lynn
yes @ twitterid get in good stuff buddy .
up the linnets !
title winners right here
get in there # coyl
fantastic , well played lads .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: tuesday 's weather : a day of mixed fortunes
text: the weather is on the turn , and we 're going to notice quite a change , depending on whereabouts in the region you are .

we have a cold front approaching , so the further north and west you are , the more chance you have of seeing cloud increase during the day but also quite a drop in the temperature , only getting to the high teens for cambridgeshire , parts of norfolk and northamptonshire .
further south though , essex in particular , we 're looking at temperatures of about 25c ( 77f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
author: Georgina Burnett
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning norfolk
text: welcome to our live coverage - it 's great to have your company .
between now and 18:00 my colleagues and i will keep you updated on what 's happening across the county .
you can join in too , by clicking on the `` get involved '' link at the top of this page .
the weather has been fabulous over the weekend has n't it , but is it going to continue today ?
georgina burnett will be along next to tell us all , and i 've had a sneak preview and i 've got to warn you , it 's not all good news for the county .
author: Philippa Taylor
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's it for friday 's regular updates , but any breaking news across will still appear here overnight .
meanwhile we wish you a very good bank holiday , hopefully in the sunshine .
we 've had a lot of news from cromer this week and not all of it was good - but we 'll leave you with this of the more peaceful side of the resort from a bbc weather watcher .
we 'll be back on tuesday from 08:00 to bring you the usual blend of news , sport , travel and weather and hope you 'll join us too .
scroll down to find out what 's been happening during the day - and have a great evening .

documents.title: weather : fine and dry with clear spells
text: a fine and dry night with clear spells , but cloud may develop from the west later in a light and variable breeze .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
after a cloudy start on saturday with the greatest risk of a shower in the north of the region , hazy sunny spells should develop with an isolated afternoon shower possible .
maximum temperature : 24c ( 75f )
sunday is looking fine and dry with highs of 25c ( 77f ) and bank holiday monday should also be dry with some decent sunny spells and feeling even warmer with temperatures reaching 28c ( 82f ) .
more details on the forecast where you live from bbc weather :
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather
